statement.p:
Simplify. Do not use a calculator!
(\sqrt{7})(\sqrt{7})
\sqrt{n}(\sqrt{n})

solution.p:
By the definition of square root, \sqrt{a} is a number whose square is a.
(\sqrt{7})(\sqrt{7})=7
\sqrt{n}(\sqrt{n})=n

statement.p:
Simplify. Do not use a calculator!
(\sqrt[3]{5})^3
(\sqrt[3]{4})(\sqrt[3]{4})(\sqrt[3]{4})

solution.p:
By the definition of square root, \sqrt[3]{a} is a number whose cube is a.
(\sqrt[3]{5})^3=5
(\sqrt[3]{4})(\sqrt[3]{4})(\sqrt[3]{4})=4
